posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked:
We are trying to start over and try simple buttons to operate the functions. We go to competition tomorrow and have a robot that drives but doesn’t do much else. Can someone help, and by help i mean clean up what we’ve got, and make it work. Simple is the key, buttons move motors. please help.

Here’s a link to what we have. We have no coders on the team and have tried every video available. Hoping someone has a little time to help. Plus is the drive works properly(except the start button disconnects us instead of resetting gyro) https://github.com/joecoleman/MAXSwerve-Java-Template--updated.git
I would be willing to take a look and try my hand at cleaning it up, however your repository appears yo be private as I get a 404 error when i try to open it

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: Sorry about that we are very green and struggling

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Give this a try and see if it helps you ! I forked your repository and made some changes ( putting button controls in the RobotContainer.java file and set up the subsystems so they can be used in the button setup portions).

GitHub - aopalka/Team5547 Contribute to aopalka/Team5547 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to aopalka/Team5547 development by creating an account on GitHub.

sorry just noticed your comment about the gyro you can change that to any other button on line 89 , here’s what it woudl look like if you changed it to the Y button :

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: The team appreciates you. thank you.
I recoded all of the subsystem for them, so can you take a look at what I have done? I also added a command ready controller so its a little less annoying to bind commands

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: You did nothing wrong , apperently it was my mistake . I needed to add the motor to the constants file just repushed the change now!

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: so we got climber ok, drive stil good. Coral intake dosent stop, continuous. algee both bumper go in same direction. No elevator or no wrist yet.

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: but you should see the kids faces…lol

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Make sure your pulling down the latest.

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: got purple lights on the wrist motor and elevator

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
I decided one more change was needed :

you will now be able to control the elevator and climbers by holding a and using the left joystick to control the speed it goes up . holding x and doing the same with the right joystick will operate your elevator. Pull down code i am pushing now. this made sense for all the required functions and not enough buttons to do things with ( unless you want to give some buttons to your driver ie an algae intake button etc.

Crazy thought make sure all the Device IDs match what is set in the code :

Algae Intake 1 is 17 Algae Intake 2 is 27 Climber 1 is 13 Coral Intake 1 is 15 Wrist 1 is 16 Elevator 1 is at 14

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: Driver is going to handle elevator and algae intake on his controller ,operator has coral in and out, the wrist movement and the climb. Thanks again for all the work. We will test tomorrow am.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
To me and many other teams what makes sense is to give driving , and the algae and coral intake to the the driver controller and the eject for algae and coral as well as the elevator to the operator so the driver can focus on aligning  up against the pickup and scoring locations and once aligned the operator can do the raising of the elevator independently. It’s very much up to team preference though!

If your competing today you are not in this alone please seek out help from volunteers and other teams in your area.

posts.name: Hale Talons 554
posts.cooked: We appreciate the advice. That makes sense too. This is the first year we have had multiple controllers. The robot is more sophisticated hence the code issues. In a perfect world we would have stops built in to the code along with angling the wrist so it was just a button push, but we are out of time and went hard on the design and build. Coding tripped us up. Our kids don’t have a class for it so they do it all, via online learning. Thanks again for all you did.
